                                                    Campaigns
The latest POLITICO scoops and coverage of the 2016 elections.

            By 
                    Henry C. Jackson

11/05/15 05:59 PM EST
THE CLOCK: 369 days until Election Day 2016 …
THE DEBATE CLOCK: Republicans do it all again in 6 days. The next Democratic debate is 10 days from now.
Story Continued Below
BILL CLINTON’S BEHIND-THE-SCENES ROLE: POLITICO’s Annie Karni reports: Eight months into HILLARY CLINTON’s second presidential run, Bill Clinton is already occupying a more significant private role as a strategic adviser than he did in 2008 when his deployment was as a public surrogate — a role that effectively ended with his angry, politically damaging diatribes in a catastrophic South Carolina primary loss to Barack Obama.
This year, his biggest influence so far has been behind the scenes, a veteran voice who can carry the day during decisive moments in the race, even if he's removed — by design — from the nitty gritty of directing the daily operation. As always, it's hard to figure out exactly what Clinton is doing — he doesn't make a habit of reading out his conversations with his wife to anyone. But people close to the Clintons tell POLITICO it's not unusual for him to sit in on big meetings or even participate in conference calls with senior staff from time to time.
And — unlike 2008 when the campaign's top staff were loyalists to his wife — his new role is enhanced by strong personal ties with top campaign chairman John Podesta, his former chief of staff at the White House, and campaign manager Robby Mook, with whom he developed a personal bond when Mook ran the campaign of his good friend, Virginia Gov. Terry McAuliffe. Read more at POLITICO http://politi.co/1GNLZhK
TGIT, let’s do it. It’s time for your 2016 Blast. Henry C. Jackson (@henrycjjackson) is here to guide you through today’s campaign news. Send your tips, complaints, and hottest hot takes to: hjackson@politico.com. 
TRAIL MIX: Here’s what’s popping on the campaign trail
In today’s campaign news, a Bern U-turn — BERNIE SANDERS says HILLARY CLINTON’s emails may be a fair question. Meanwhile, Sanders registers as a Democrat in New Hampshire and MARTIN O’MALLEY’s moment might be coming. On the GOP side, DONALD TRUMP once courted the big donors he lambastes, BEN CARSON gets scrutiny, while he and Trump both get security. JEB BUSH opens up about his daughter’s struggle with addiction, MARCO RUBIO tries to make his age an asset and CHRIS CHRISTIE pledges to debate you any time, anywhere.  
THE DAILY CLINTON
U-TURN: The Wall Street Journal has an interview with BERNIE SANDERS in which he’s much more aggressive at drawing sharp distinctions with HILLARY CLINTON and even raises the specter of her emails — after seemingly taking the issue off the table at the last Democratic debate. Per the WSJ, Sanders “is casting her policy reversals over the years as a character issue that voters should take into account” and said her email practices were “valid questions” if they thwarted public-records requests or compromised classified information. http://on.wsj.com/1PnGSpu 
HONESTY ISSUES: The Washington Post says HILLARY CLINTON’s current sanguine outlook belies broader issues with her perceived honesty, and that may haunt her in a general election. “To win … she has to prove to swing voters that she is the sort of person that they can and should trust with leading the country over the next (at least) four years. That won't be easy because Clinton is both totally known by the electorate and not seen in that light by a majority of them in most polls.” http://wapo.st/1MCe9Za 
FAMILY BUSINESS: ABC looks at a group of (Bill) Clinton devotees who are reuniting to back HILLARY CLINTON. The “Arkansas Travelers” have no official affiliation with the Clintons, but have relationships going back decades, even to childhood. http://abcn.ws/1iF9NIS 
WHAT A GIRL WANTS: Billboard reports that HILLARY CLINTON raised more than $1 million dollars at the home of singer Christina Aguilera during a West Coast fundraising trip. “Clinton opened her remarks by telling the crowd that she is inspired by Aguilera’s song 'Fighter' and plans to fight for 'everyday Americans.'" http://bit.ly/1PbVwla 
THE PROGRESSIVE RESISTANCE
SO LONG, SOCIALISM: ABC News reports BERNIE SANDERS will declare himself a Democrat on Thursday in order to appear on New Hampshire’s primary ballot. “Like many other presidential candidates this week, Sanders plans make an official stop at New Hampshire Secretary of State’s office to file his ‘Declaration of Candidacy’ form for the first primary in the nation … The Sanders campaign confirmed to ABC News that Sanders will write in 'Democrat' on the form. It also brushed aside any concerns over potential ballot challenges.” http://abcn.ws/1l938Zh 
PARTY PERSON: POLITICO’s Gabriel Debenedetti reports BERNIE SANDERS has reached a joint fundraising agreement with the Democratic National Committee. “The move, which comes more than two months after HILLARY CLINTON’s campaign signed such an agreement in August, will allow Sanders' team to raise up to $33,400 for the committee as well as $2,700 for the campaign from individual donors at events.” http://politi.co/1NSqICQ 
MARTY’S MOMENT?: Yahoo! suggests next week will — finally — be the moment that MARTIN O’MALLEY gets a chance to break through. “After toiling away in obscurity for much of the year, barely registering in polls or even in the public consciousness, O’Malley suddenly finds himself — as he likes to put it with his dry wit — in sole possession of third place. ‘I really feel like the campaign started in earnest 10 days ago, after the first debate,’ he said." http://yhoo.it/1NSubRX 
TRUMP ON THE STUMP
THINK BIG: POLITICO’s Kenneth P. Vogel and Ben Schreckinger report “DONALD TRUMP has spent much of his presidential campaign bashing his GOP rivals as beholden to major donors, and, in recent weeks, he’s expanded his attacks to include three major donors in particular ― Sheldon Adelson, Paul Singer and the Koch brothers. But POLITICO has learned that Trump or his surrogates have sought to build relationships ― if not support ― from all three, calling into question the billionaire real estate showman’s repeated assertions that, because of his wealth, he has no use for major donors.” http://politi.co/1MlHDhX 
NEVER GIVE UP: Business Insider reports DONALD TRUMP denied POLITICO’s story and (implausibly) denies knowing who GOP mega-donor Paul Singer is. http://read.bi/1NfHCJ1 
TIME TO GET TOUGH: POLITICO’s Eliza Collins reports DONALD TRUMP and BEN CARSON are getting Secret Service details. DHS spokesman Todd Breasseale says Secret Service will work with the campaigns to work out the timeframe to start the protection. http://politi.co/1Qh2d4V 
SURVIVING AT THE TOP: CNN reports DONALD TRUMP is up with his first campaign ads, “radio ads set to air in the early primary states” which “tout Trump's business experience, slam politicians as ‘all talk and no action’ and play up Trump's pledge to build a wall on the U.S.-Mexico border. The $300,000 in ad buys will air in the first three primary states of Iowa, New Hampshire and South Carolina.” http://cnn.it/1l9hqcp 
CARSON’S COURSE
SCRUTINY ARRIVES: POLITICO’S Nick Gass reports BEN CARSON found himself on the defensive on Thursday, a reporters pressed him on a slew of stories that have “sprung up questioning the factual accuracy of his past statements. As Carson has gained in the polls, so has media scrutiny of the 64-year-old retired pediatric neurosurgeon and Republican presidential candidate, whose past and present statements have drawn no shortage of curiosity and interest.” http://politi.co/1PqkcoO 
RESTROOM RIGHTS: In the same interview Fusion reports that BEN CARSON called for the creation of transgender bathrooms. “It is not fair for them to make everybody else uncomfortable. It’s one of the things that I don’t particularly like … I think everybody has equal rights, but I’m not sure that anybody should have extra rights.” 
JEB’S JOURNEY
DAUGHTER’S STRUGGLE: Huffington Post has a revealing, at times wrenching interview with JEB BUSH as he discusses his daughter Noelle’s battle with drug addiction. “Bush spoke in highly personal terms about the toll that his daughter’s struggles took on her famous family. ‘She went through hell,’ Bush said. ‘And so did her mom and so did her dad. And it was in a private setting, but then it became very public when I was governor. And it wasn’t easy.’" http://huff.to/1Q6WM9B 
BRO BACKER: POLITICO’s Nick Gass reports JEB BUSH vouched for his brother former President George W. Bush’s independence “after the release of excerpts from his father's upcoming biography that harshly criticized the negative influence of former Vice President Dick Cheney and Defense Secretary Donald Rumsfeld. In response, Bush said that his older brother is 'a big boy' and that his father and others are attempting to "create a different narrative." http://politi.co/1kwZ0l7 
GRANITE GUARANTEE: POLITICO’s Nick Gass reports JEB BUSH has guaranteed a victory in the New Hampshire primary. What’s the worst that could happen? http://politi.co/1ML6rlK 
RUBIO’S RACE
‘OUTDATED’ ATTACK: The Washington Post reports MARCO RUBIO tried to make his “youth an asset in foreign affairs” during a campaign stop in New Hampshire on Thursday. “arguing … that the nation's security is being compromised by Washington's ‘outdated political establishment’ and that he would be a nimble commander in chief. … "The nature of warfare is always changing and the leaders of the past are almost always blind to these changes," Rubio said, extending his criticism to "outdated leaders" of both political parties. http://wapo.st/1LSGs8l 
NOTED: “As Rubio spoke in Manchester, he was missing a vote back in Washington on a defense appropriations bill.”
DEFENSIVE SPECIALIST: Bloomberg: MARCO RUBIO “seems to be deftly swatting away attacks from rivals DONALD TRUMP and JEB BUSH, but the barrage coming his way over missed Senate votes, immigration reform and mismanagement of personal finances have prompted him to quietly fine-tune his campaign as he rises in the polls and picks up big donors.” http://bloom.bg/1OrAS0q 
GAS TAX RELAX: The Hill: MARCO RUBIO “is calling for the 18.4 cents-per-gallon gas tax that pays for most federal transportation projects to be cut by 80 percent. The 2016 presidential hopeful said in a post on his campaign website that the gas tax should be cut because it is ‘outdated’ and replaced by a system that allows states to take the lead on financing transportation projects.” http://bit.ly/1MLf6ok 
SURVEYING THE 2016 LANDSCAPE
ONE WAY OR ANOTHER: POLITICO’s Daniel Strauss reports CHRIS CHRISTIE said he’d be debating next week, whether he made the main stage or not. “The bottom line is you need to be on a stage and debating. And so I will be on a stage and debating one way or the other wherever they put me. You put one in the middle of the square in Manchester, I'll do it there," he said. http://politi.co/1kdlIPM 
GETTING IT IN: The New York Times reports JOHN KASICH had a few minutes between events on Thursday, so “taking advantage of a gorgeous fall day, he walked to the driving range and took four swings. He was quite pleased with his shots, exclaiming to his staff after every swing how true he had hit the ball.” http://nyti.ms/1RZbixs 
‘TASTE THE FAT’: That’s comedian Asiz Ansari’s proposed slogan for BOBBY JINDAL. Watch this shtick from Jimmy Fallon to understand more: http://ti.me/1PdwH8w 
ENEMIES LIST: TPM highlights a fundraising appeal from RICK SANTORUM that notes he’s taken on both the “ladies of The View” and, uh, Islamic State terrorists. http://bit.ly/1HdfZU6 
KING’S WARNING: Breitbart Iowa Rep. Steve King “is warning Americans — and Iowans — that a massive amnesty for all of America’s illegal aliens may be unstoppable if Marco Rubio is elected president. ‘With Rep. Paul Ryan as Speaker, we have this big question about what amnesty might be not in this Congress but with the next president,’ King said on Breitbart News Daily on SiriusXM 125 the Patriot Channel with Breitbart News’ Executive Chairman Stephen K. Bannon. ‘I have apprehension about that.’” http://bit.ly/1kd3bDj 
NEXT NEWS CYCLE
The Democrats HILLARY CLINTON, BERNIE SANDERS and MARTIN O’MALLEY, attend a first in the south forum in South Carolina.
 MARCO RUBIO has a Florida fundraiser.
 JOHN KASICH is in New Hampshire, as is CARLY FIORINA and CHRIS CHRISTIE.
 TED CRUZ hits Des Moines, Iowa. 
THE DAILY NUMBER
+21. That’s BEN CARSON’s net favorability in a new favorability survey by Gallup. That makes him the most favorably viewed presidential candidate in the field. http://bit.ly/1Sta4eV 
FOLLOW @POLITICO’S politics team: @PoliticoCharlie, @POLITICO_Steve, @PoliticoAlex, @anniekarini, @GlennThrush, @EliStokols, @katieglueck, @shreckreports, @gdebenedetti, @Hadas_Gold, @ec_schneider, @kyledcheney , @theodoricmeyer, @MarcACaputo, @PoliticoKevin,@mikeallen, @dlippman, @Danielstrauss4, @henrycjjackson, @shanegoldmacher,@KristinPolitico
Henry C. Jackson is a reporter.

                                                    David Makovsky

description: Eight months into Hillary Clinton’s second presidential run, Bill Clinton is already occupying a more significant private role as a strategic adviser than he did in 2008
title: Bill Clinton's behind-the-scenes role
